meanings.definition: The practice or adherence to a routine or set of routines.
meanings.sent1: Her routinism involved waking up at the same time every day.
meanings.sent2: His routinism included following the same schedule for years.
meanings.sent3: The cat's routinism of meowing for breakfast at dawn always made the family laugh.
meanings.sent4: The routinism of the daily commute felt like being stuck in a never-ending loop.
meanings.sent5: The routinism of watering the plants every morning became ingrained in her daily life.

meanings.definition: The belief in or promotion of routine as a way of life.
meanings.sent1: Their routinism led them to plan every minute of their day.
meanings.sent2: She embraced routinism as a means to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent3: The town's routinism of early dinners puzzled the visiting tourists.
meanings.sent4: The routinism of always taking the same path symbolized his fear of change.
meanings.sent5: The routinism of attending the same church service every Sunday shaped her sense of community.
